basCmtsConfigMib.name: basCmtsConfigMib
basCmtsConfigMib.contactinfo: Tech Support Broadband Access Systems 201 Forest Street Marlboro, MA 01752 U.S.A. 508-485-8200 support@basystems.com
basCmtsConfigMib.description: This MIB module defines the configuration MIB objects for a Broadband Access System CMTS.

TenthdBmV.name: TenthdBmV
TenthdBmV.description: This data type represents power levels that are normally expressed in dBmV. Units are in tenths of a dBmV; for example, 5.1 dBmV will be represented as 51.

BasCmtsHeadEndMapMode.name: BasCmtsHeadEndMapMode
BasCmtsHeadEndMapMode.description: HeadEndMgr map mode. 0 = Normal, free running maps. 99 = Scripted maps for test and debug.

basCmtsHeadEndTable.name: basCmtsHeadEndTable
basCmtsHeadEndTable.description: A list of HeadEndMgr settings. The number of entries is given by the value of ifNumber.

basCmtsHeadEndEntry.name: basCmtsHeadEndEntry
basCmtsHeadEndEntry.description: An entry containing HeadEndMgr configuration settings. An entry in this table exists for each ifEntry with an ifType of docsCableMacLayer(127).

basCmtsHeHwMapTimerPeriodMicrosec.name: basCmtsHeHwMapTimerPeriodMicrosec
basCmtsHeHwMapTimerPeriodMicrosec.description: CMTS hardware Map timer period interval, in microseconds.

basCmtsHeImMapTimerPeriodMillisec.name: basCmtsHeImMapTimerPeriodMillisec
basCmtsHeImMapTimerPeriodMillisec.description: CMTS initial maintenance timer period interval, in milliseconds.

basCmtsHePerRngTimerPeriodSec.name: basCmtsHePerRngTimerPeriodSec
basCmtsHePerRngTimerPeriodSec.description: CMTS periodic ranging timer period interval, in seconds.

basCmtsHeUcdTimerPerMillisec.name: basCmtsHeUcdTimerPerMillisec
basCmtsHeUcdTimerPerMillisec.description: CMTS UCD periodic timer period interval, in milliseconds.

basCmtsHeMapMode.name: basCmtsHeMapMode
basCmtsHeMapMode.description: CMTS mape mode, either Normal or Scripted maps for test mode. Defaults to normal, free-running mode.

basCmtsHeRowAction.name: basCmtsHeRowAction
basCmtsHeRowAction.description: An action object used to effect an action.

basCmtsMacTable.name: basCmtsMacTable
basCmtsMacTable.description: A list of BAS Mac settings.

basCmtsMacEntry.name: basCmtsMacEntry
basCmtsMacEntry.description: An entry containing BAS Mac configuration settings. An entry in this table exists for each ifEntry with an ifType of docsCableMacLayer(127).

basCmtsMacNumUsBds.name: basCmtsMacNumUsBds
basCmtsMacNumUsBds.description: Number of buffers allocated to handle upstream cable modem traffic, both control message and data message traffic.

basCmtsMacNumDsMsgBds.name: basCmtsMacNumDsMsgBds
basCmtsMacNumDsMsgBds.description: Number of buffers allocated to handle downstream cable modem control message traffic.

basCmtsMacNumDsDataBds.name: basCmtsMacNumDsDataBds
basCmtsMacNumDsDataBds.description: Number of buffers allocated to handle downstream cable modem data message traffic.

basCmtsMacNumIpBuffers.name: basCmtsMacNumIpBuffers
basCmtsMacNumIpBuffers.description: Number of buffers allocated to handle downstream cable modem data message traffic. If an IP packet is addressed to the CMTS Mac address, an IP Buffer is allocated to send the data to the local host IP stack (bcmnet_fd). TBD - We probably don't need this.

basCmtsMacPciDmaSize.name: basCmtsMacPciDmaSize
basCmtsMacPciDmaSize.description: Maximum size of PCI bus DMA transaction, required by BCM3210.

basCmtsMacUpdateFirstParticleLast.name: basCmtsMacUpdateFirstParticleLast
basCmtsMacUpdateFirstParticleLast.description: MAC control register option flag: if true, then update first particle last.

basCmtsMacDirectModeDma.name: basCmtsMacDirectModeDma
basCmtsMacDirectModeDma.description: MAC control register option flag: if true, then enable direct mode DMA.

basCmtsMacPackedPart.name: basCmtsMacPackedPart
basCmtsMacPackedPart.description: Packed particle boolean, FALSE indicates 1 particle per packet.

basCmtsMacPackedPartOffset.name: basCmtsMacPackedPartOffset
basCmtsMacPackedPartOffset.description: Packed particle offset, offset for header length in packed particle.

basCmtsMacSyncRate.name: basCmtsMacSyncRate
basCmtsMacSyncRate.description: Specifies the downstream Sync control message interval. Units are millisec. Default rate is 10 millisec.

basCmtsMacDsHwTable.name: basCmtsMacDsHwTable
basCmtsMacDsHwTable.description: A list of Bas Downstream settings.

basCmtsMacDsHwEntry.name: basCmtsMacDsHwEntry
basCmtsMacDsHwEntry.description: An entry containing Bas Mac DsHw configuration settings. An entry in this table exists for each ifEntry with an ifType of docsCableMacLayer(127).

basCmtsMacDsHwQamctl.name: basCmtsMacDsHwQamctl
basCmtsMacDsHwQamctl.description: Specifies Mac DsHw QAM control. 0x03 = 64 QAM 0x05 = 256 QAM.

basCmtsMacDsHwSymbolRate.name: basCmtsMacDsHwSymbolRate
basCmtsMacDsHwSymbolRate.description: Specifies Mac DsHw symbol rate, in Units Baud. Typical values: 64 QAM - 5056941 baud (default) 256 QAM - 5360537 baud

basCmtsMacDsHwIfFreq.name: basCmtsMacDsHwIfFreq
basCmtsMacDsHwIfFreq.description: Specifies Mac DsHw downstream channel frequency, in Hz.

basCmtsMacDsHwRefFreq.name: basCmtsMacDsHwRefFreq
basCmtsMacDsHwRefFreq.description: Specifies Mac DsHw reference frequency, in Hz.

basCmtsMacDsHwOscMultFactor.name: basCmtsMacDsHwOscMultFactor
basCmtsMacDsHwOscMultFactor.description: Specifies Mac DsHw Osc Mult Factor. For Bcm3210, use: refFreq (MHz) MultFactor ------------- ---------- 114.0 1 28.5 4 28.322 4 20.48 6

basCmtsUpstreamChannelTable.name: basCmtsUpstreamChannelTable
basCmtsUpstreamChannelTable.description: A list of HeadEndMgr settings. The number of entries is given by the value of ifNumber.

basCmtsUpstreamChannelEntry.name: basCmtsUpstreamChannelEntry
basCmtsUpstreamChannelEntry.description: An entry containing HeadEndMgr configuration settings. An entry in this table exists for each ifEntry with an ifType of docsCableUpstream(129).

basCmtsUpChannelReceivePower.name: basCmtsUpChannelReceivePower
basCmtsUpChannelReceivePower.description: Receive Power level that is desired at the CMTS in TenthdbMV

BasCmtsModulationWsPattern.name: BasCmtsModulationWsPattern
BasCmtsModulationWsPattern.description: Bas upstream channel burst descriptor unique word pattern.

basCmtsModulationTable.name: basCmtsModulationTable
basCmtsModulationTable.description: A list of HeadEndMgr settings. The number of entries is given by the value of ifNumber.

basCmtsModulationEntry.name: basCmtsModulationEntry
basCmtsModulationEntry.description: An entry containing HeadEndMgr configuration settings.

basCmtsModUwLenBytes.name: basCmtsModUwLenBytes
basCmtsModUwLenBytes.description: Length of unique word pattern, in bytes. [Note = Supported values are 1-3 for BCM3137. Default value is 1, equal to 4 symbols.

basCmtsModUwPattern.name: basCmtsModUwPattern
basCmtsModUwPattern.description: Content of unique word pattern. The number of bytes in the unique word pattern which are relevant is determined by basCmtsModUwLenBytes.

basCmtsModUwDetectionWindow.name: basCmtsModUwDetectionWindow
basCmtsModUwDetectionWindow.description: Time window around a nominal detection time in which the UW detector is enabled.

basCmtsModUwMismatchThresholdBits.name: basCmtsModUwMismatchThresholdBits
basCmtsModUwMismatchThresholdBits.description: Specifies precision of match between unique word pattern and incoming burst by specifying the number of bits which are allowed to NOT match.

basCmtsModPreambleValueOffset.name: basCmtsModPreambleValueOffset
basCmtsModPreambleValueOffset.description: Offset into preamble where value bits, or pattern, begins.

basCmtsUsHwTable.name: basCmtsUsHwTable
basCmtsUsHwTable.description: A list of HeadEndMgr settings. The number of entries is given by the value of ifNumber.

basCmtsUsHwEntry.name: basCmtsUsHwEntry
basCmtsUsHwEntry.description: An entry containing HeadEndMgr configuration settings.

basCmtsUsHwPreambleCtl.name: basCmtsUsHwPreambleCtl
basCmtsUsHwPreambleCtl.description: Bas Bcm3137 preamble process control register.

basCmtsUsHwCarrAcf.name: basCmtsUsHwCarrAcf
basCmtsUsHwCarrAcf.description: Bas Bcm3137 carrier acquisition loop coefficients.

basCmtsUsHwCarrTcf.name: basCmtsUsHwCarrTcf
basCmtsUsHwCarrTcf.description: Bas Bcm3137 carrier tracking loop coefficients.

basCmtsUsHwBaudAtcf.name: basCmtsUsHwBaudAtcf
basCmtsUsHwBaudAtcf.description: Bas Bcm3137 baud loop acquisition/tracking coefficients.

basCmtsUsHwBaudIntcf.name: basCmtsUsHwBaudIntcf
basCmtsUsHwBaudIntcf.description: Bas Bcm3137 baud loop integrator coefficients.

basCmtsUsHwMaxPwrThr.name: basCmtsUsHwMaxPwrThr
basCmtsUsHwMaxPwrThr.description: Bas Bcm3137 maximum power level threshold.

basCmtsUsHwMinPwrThr.name: basCmtsUsHwMinPwrThr
basCmtsUsHwMinPwrThr.description: Bas Bcm3137 minimum power level threshold.

basCmtsUsHwTimeErrThr.name: basCmtsUsHwTimeErrThr
basCmtsUsHwTimeErrThr.description: Bas Bcm3137 burst timing error threshold.

basCmtsUsHwAdcClipCtl.name: basCmtsUsHwAdcClipCtl
basCmtsUsHwAdcClipCtl.description: Bas Bcm3137 ADC clipping detection control register.

basCmtsUsHwLoopCheck.name: basCmtsUsHwLoopCheck
basCmtsUsHwLoopCheck.description: Bas Bcm3137 loop checking detection control register.

basCmtsUsHwAfltSelThr.name: basCmtsUsHwAfltSelThr
basCmtsUsHwAfltSelThr.description: Bas Bcm3137 amplitude filter selection threshold.

basCmtsUsHwBurstGain.name: basCmtsUsHwBurstGain
basCmtsUsHwBurstGain.description: Bas Bcm3137 burst gain adjusting factor register.

basCmtsUsHwEqRsCtl.name: basCmtsUsHwEqRsCtl
basCmtsUsHwEqRsCtl.description: Bas Bcm3137 equalizer/RS decoder control register.

basCmtsUsHwEqSteps.name: basCmtsUsHwEqSteps
basCmtsUsHwEqSteps.description: Bas Bcm3137 equalizer adaptation step size register.

basCmtsUsMapTable.name: basCmtsUsMapTable
basCmtsUsMapTable.description: A Upstream Channel Map Maker Settings.

basCmtsUsMapEntry.name: basCmtsUsMapEntry
basCmtsUsMapEntry.description: An entry containing Upstream Channel Map Maker configuration settings.

basCmtsUsMapMaxMapLenHwMapPeriods.name: basCmtsUsMapMaxMapLenHwMapPeriods
basCmtsUsMapMaxMapLenHwMapPeriods.description: Bas Upstream Channel MapMaker maximum map length, in units of hardware map timer periods. [Note: Set this value large enough to handle large packets, but small enough to not let latency get too large when channel is busy.]

basCmtsUsMapInitMainRegionSizeMicrosec.name: basCmtsUsMapInitMainRegionSizeMicrosec
basCmtsUsMapInitMainRegionSizeMicrosec.description: Bas Upstream Channel MapMaker size of Initial Maint contention region, in microseconds. [Note: Maps with Initial Maint regions are sent periodically. Most maps do not have an Initial Maint region.]

basCmtsUsMapNewUcdGrantSizeMicrosec.name: basCmtsUsMapNewUcdGrantSizeMicrosec
basCmtsUsMapNewUcdGrantSizeMicrosec.description: Bas Upstream Channel MapMaker new UCD grant size. After a UCD change, this specifies the size of grant to null sid (which functions as a delay for CM's to digest the new UCD), in microseconds.

basCmtsUsMapMaxDeferredRngIE.name: basCmtsUsMapMaxDeferredRngIE
basCmtsUsMapMaxDeferredRngIE.description: Bas Upstream Channel MapMaker maximum number of deferred ranging invitations per map.

basCmtsUsMapMapLeadTimeMillisec.name: basCmtsUsMapMapLeadTimeMillisec
basCmtsUsMapMapLeadTimeMillisec.description: Bas Upstream Channel MapMaker map lead time, in milliseconds.

basCmtsUsMapRequestLimitMslot.name: basCmtsUsMapRequestLimitMslot
basCmtsUsMapRequestLimitMslot.description: Bas Upstream Channel MapMaker maximum size for request contention region, in mini-slots.

basCmtsUsMapMapLeadTime.name: basCmtsUsMapMapLeadTime
basCmtsUsMapMapLeadTime.description: Bas Upstream Channel MapMaker map lead time, in microseconds.

basCmtsUsRngTable.name: basCmtsUsRngTable
basCmtsUsRngTable.description: A Upstream Channel Range Finder Settings.

basCmtsUsRngEntry.name: basCmtsUsRngEntry
basCmtsUsRngEntry.description: An entry containing Upstream Channel Range Finder configuration settings.

basCmtsUsRngTimingOffsetThr.name: basCmtsUsRngTimingOffsetThr
basCmtsUsRngTimingOffsetThr.description: Bas Upstream Channel RangeFinder timing offset threshold. If timing offset reported by MAC chip is <= this threshold value, then timing adjustment may be stopped. Units are 10.24 MHz clock cycles.

basCmtsUsRngFreqOffsetThr.name: basCmtsUsRngFreqOffsetThr
basCmtsUsRngFreqOffsetThr.description: Bas Upstream Channel RangeFinder frequency offset threshold. If frequency offset reported by MAC chip is <= this threshold value, then frequency adjustment may be stopped. (Hz units).

basCmtsUsRngPowerOffsetThr.name: basCmtsUsRngPowerOffsetThr
basCmtsUsRngPowerOffsetThr.description: Bas Upstream Channel RangeFinder power offset threshold. If power level offset reported by MAC chip is <= this threshold value, then power level adjustment may be stopped. (1/4 dB units).

basCmtsUsRngPowerDesired.name: basCmtsUsRngPowerDesired
basCmtsUsRngPowerDesired.description: Bas Upstream Channel RangeFinder power desired. Desired linear power level. Used as reference when computing power adjustment. Units are a Broadcom defined (16) bit linear scale.

basCmtsUsRngMaxIgnoredInvitations.name: basCmtsUsRngMaxIgnoredInvitations
basCmtsUsRngMaxIgnoredInvitations.description: Bas Upstream Channel RangeFinder maximum ignored invitations. Maximum ranging invitations that a CM may ignore before being considered quiet.

basCmtsUsRngCmRngInviteTimeout.name: basCmtsUsRngCmRngInviteTimeout
basCmtsUsRngCmRngInviteTimeout.description: Bas Upstream Channel RangeFinder cable modem range invite timeout. Minimum time allowed for a CM following receipt of a RNG-RSP before it is expected to reply to an invitation to range request, in milliseconds.

basCmtsUsRngMaxPowerAdjQtrdb.name: basCmtsUsRngMaxPowerAdjQtrdb
basCmtsUsRngMaxPowerAdjQtrdb.description: Bas Upstream Channel RangeFinder maximum power adjustment for a particular RNG-RSP message, in 1/4dB units.

basCmtsUsRngZeroPowerAdj.name: basCmtsUsRngZeroPowerAdj
basCmtsUsRngZeroPowerAdj.description: Bas Upstream Channel RangeFinder zero power adjustment. If true, power adjustment item in range response message will be unconditionally set to 0. Useful for debugging.

basCmtsUsRngZeroTimingAdj.name: basCmtsUsRngZeroTimingAdj
basCmtsUsRngZeroTimingAdj.description: Bas Upstream Channel RangeFinder zero timing adjustment. If true, timing adjustment item in range response message will be unconditionally set to 0. Useful for debugging.

basCmtsUsRngZeroFreqAdj.name: basCmtsUsRngZeroFreqAdj
basCmtsUsRngZeroFreqAdj.description: Bas Upstream Channel RangeFinder zero frequency adjustment. If true, frequency adjustment item in range response message will be unconditionally set to 0. Useful for debugging.

basCmtsUsRngRefPowerLevel.name: basCmtsUsRngRefPowerLevel
basCmtsUsRngRefPowerLevel.description: Reference power level for this upstream channel.

basCmtsUsRngCmPeriodicRngInviteTimeout.name: basCmtsUsRngCmPeriodicRngInviteTimeout
basCmtsUsRngCmPeriodicRngInviteTimeout.description: Used to space the ranging invitations, if the modem has completed ranging.

basCmtsUsStatsTable.name: basCmtsUsStatsTable
basCmtsUsStatsTable.description: Contains statistics for each upstream channel.

basCmtsUsStatsEntry.name: basCmtsUsStatsEntry
basCmtsUsStatsEntry.description: An entry containing statistics for each upstream channel.

basCmtsUsStatsClearFlag.name: basCmtsUsStatsClearFlag
basCmtsUsStatsClearFlag.description: Writing any value to this mib clears all stats in this table.

basCmtsUsStatsUSSlots.name: basCmtsUsStatsUSSlots
basCmtsUsStatsUSSlots.description: Number upstream data information elements in Maps.

basCmtsUsStatsNoUW.name: basCmtsUsStatsNoUW
basCmtsUsStatsNoUW.description: Number upstream data packets with FEC No Unique Word.

basCmtsUsStatsDataFECorHCSErr.name: basCmtsUsStatsDataFECorHCSErr
basCmtsUsStatsDataFECorHCSErr.description: Number upstream data packets with FEC or HCS Error.

basCmtsUsStatsReqFECorHCSErr.name: basCmtsUsStatsReqFECorHCSErr
basCmtsUsStatsReqFECorHCSErr.description: Number request slots corrupted by bad FEC or HCS.

basCmtsUsStatsReqNoEnergy.name: basCmtsUsStatsReqNoEnergy
basCmtsUsStatsReqNoEnergy.description: Number request slots with no energy.

basCmtsUsStatsReqDataFECorHCSErr.name: basCmtsUsStatsReqDataFECorHCSErr
basCmtsUsStatsReqDataFECorHCSErr.description: Number request/data slots with FEC or HCS errors.

basCmtsUsStatsReqDataNoEnergy.name: basCmtsUsStatsReqDataNoEnergy
basCmtsUsStatsReqDataNoEnergy.description: Number request/data slots with no energy.

basCmtsUsStatsRangeFECorHCSErr.name: basCmtsUsStatsRangeFECorHCSErr
basCmtsUsStatsRangeFECorHCSErr.description: Number ranging slots with FEC or HCS errors.

basCmtsUsStatsMapsTooLate.name: basCmtsUsStatsMapsTooLate
basCmtsUsStatsMapsTooLate.description: Number of Maps too late detected.

basCmtsServiceTable.name: basCmtsServiceTable
basCmtsServiceTable.description: The Service Table per MAC IF

basCmtsServiceEntry.name: basCmtsServiceEntry
basCmtsServiceEntry.description: An entry containing information for a particular SID

basCmtsServiceMacAddress.name: basCmtsServiceMacAddress
basCmtsServiceMacAddress.description: MAC address of this Cable Modem. If the Cable Modem has multiple MAC addresses, this is the MAC address associated with the Cable interface.

basCmtsServiceOutOctets.name: basCmtsServiceOutOctets
basCmtsServiceOutOctets.description: The number of service out octets.

basCmtsServiceOutPackets.name: basCmtsServiceOutPackets
basCmtsServiceOutPackets.description: The number of service out packets.

basCmtsServiceInDiscards.name: basCmtsServiceInDiscards
basCmtsServiceInDiscards.description: The number of input packets discarded.

basCmtsServiceOutDiscards.name: basCmtsServiceOutDiscards
basCmtsServiceOutDiscards.description: The number of output packets discarded.

basCmtsServiceBwReqCount.name: basCmtsServiceBwReqCount
basCmtsServiceBwReqCount.description: The bandwidth request count for this service.

basCmtsServiceDataGrantCount.name: basCmtsServiceDataGrantCount
basCmtsServiceDataGrantCount.description: The data grant count for this service.

basFlapControlTable.name: basFlapControlTable
basFlapControlTable.description: Defines the flap table control settings per MAC IF. A flap-list is a table maintained for every modem (active or not) that is having communication difficulties. Flapping refers to the rapid disconneting and reconneting of a cable modem that is having problems holding a connection. The flap list contains modem MAC addresses and logs the time of the most recent activity. The size and entry thresholds for the flap list can be configured.

basFlapControlEntry.name: basFlapControlEntry
basFlapControlEntry.description: Defines the flap table control settings. An entry in this table exists for each ifEntry with an ifType of docsCableMacLayer(127).

basFlapCtlClearFlag.name: basFlapCtlClearFlag
basFlapCtlClearFlag.description: Flap list clear control flag. Setting this flag to 1 empties the flap-list table.

basFlapCtlMaxTableSize.name: basFlapCtlMaxTableSize
basFlapCtlMaxTableSize.description: Specifies the max size of the flap-list table. Setting table size to 0 disables flap-list table maintenance.

basFlapCtlAgingThresh.name: basFlapCtlAgingThresh
basFlapCtlAgingThresh.description: Specifies the number of days to age the cable modem from the flap list table. Setting the aging threshold to 0 results in modems never being aged from the table.

basFlapCtlInsTimeThresh.name: basFlapCtlInsTimeThresh
basFlapCtlInsTimeThresh.description: Specifies the insertion time threshold, in seconds. This threshold controls the operation of a flapping modem detector. When the link establishment rate of a modem is shorter than the period defined by this parameter, the modem is placed in the flap list. Setting this parameter to 0 results in modems never being inserted in the flap list table due to short link establishment times.

basFlapCtlPowerAdjThresh.name: basFlapCtlPowerAdjThresh
basFlapCtlPowerAdjThresh.description: Specifies the power-adjust threshold for recording a flap list event. When the power adjustment of a modem exceeds the threshold, the modem is placed in the flap list. Setting this parameter to 0 results in modems never being inserted in the flap list table due to power adjustments.

basFlapTable.name: basFlapTable
basFlapTable.description: Defines the flap table per MAC IF and MacAddr. A flap-list is a table maintained for every modem (active or not) that is having communication difficulties. Flapping refers to the rapid disconnetin and reconneting of a cable modem that is having problems holding a connection. The flap list contains modem MAC addresses and logs the time of the most recent activity. The size and entry thresholds for the flap list can be configured.

basFlapEntry.name: basFlapEntry
basFlapEntry.description: Defines the flap table entries. An entry in this table exists for each ifEntry with an ifType of docsCableMacLayer(127) and for every MacAddress.

basFlapEntryUsChan.name: basFlapEntryUsChan
basFlapEntryUsChan.description: Specifies the upstream channel the specified modem is currently using.

basFlapEntryInsertCount.name: basFlapEntryInsertCount
basFlapEntryInsertCount.description: Specifies the number of time the modem comes up and inserts itself into the network. It can indicate intermittent downstream sync loss or DHCP or modem registration problems.

basFlapEntryHitCount.name: basFlapEntryHitCount
basFlapEntryHitCount.description: Specifies the number of time the modem responds to MAC layer keep alive messages. It can indicate intermittent upstream, laser clipping, or common-path distortion.

basFlapEntryMissCount.name: basFlapEntryMissCount
basFlapEntryMissCount.description: Specifies the number of time the modem misses the MAC layer keep alive messages. It can indicate intermittent upstream, laser clipping, or common-path distortion.

basFlapEntryCRCErrCount.name: basFlapEntryCRCErrCount
basFlapEntryCRCErrCount.description: Specifies the number of Cyclic Redundancy Check errors from this modem. It can indicate intermittent upstream, laser clipping, or common-path distortion.

basFlapEntryPAdjCount.name: basFlapEntryPAdjCount
basFlapEntryPAdjCount.description: Specifies the number of times the headend instructed the modem to adjust transmit power more than the threshold-specified number of dB. It can indicate amplifier degradation, poor connections, or thermal sensitivity.

basFlapEntryFlapCount.name: basFlapEntryFlapCount
basFlapEntryFlapCount.description: Specifies the sum of basFlapEntryPAdjCount and basFlapEntryInsertCount.

basFlapEntryLastModemState.name: basFlapEntryLastModemState
basFlapEntryLastModemState.description: Specifies the modem state when this modem last flapped. State is as specified in the RF Interface Specification, and indicates the following events: other(1) Any state other than below. ranging(2) The CMTS has received an Initial Ranging Request message from the CM, and the ranging process is not yet complete. rangingAborted(3) The CMTS has sent a Ranging Abort message to the CM. rangingComplete(4) The CMTS has sent a Ranging Complete message to the CM. ipComplete(5) The CMTS has received a DHCP reply message and forwarded it to the CM. registrationComplete(6) The CMTS has sent a Registration Response mesage to the CM. accessDenied(7) The CMTS has sent a Registration Aborted message to the CM.

basFlapEntryInsertTime.name: basFlapEntryInsertTime
basFlapEntryInsertTime.description: Specifies the most recent time that the modem was inserted in the network.

basFlapEntryRemoveTime.name: basFlapEntryRemoveTime
basFlapEntryRemoveTime.description: Specifies the most recent time that the modem dropped the connection.

basFlapEntryLastBasModemState.name: basFlapEntryLastBasModemState
basFlapEntryLastBasModemState.description: Specifies the modem state when this modem last flapped. State is as specified in the basCmtsCmStatusValue mib.

basCmtsCmStatusTable.name: basCmtsCmStatusTable
basCmtsCmStatusTable.description: A list of CMTS CM status settings.

basCmtsCmStatusEntry.name: basCmtsCmStatusEntry
basCmtsCmStatusEntry.description: An entry in this table exists for each entry in the docsIfCmtsCmStatusTable.

basCmtsCmStatusAbortFlag.name: basCmtsCmStatusAbortFlag
basCmtsCmStatusAbortFlag.description: CMTS CM status clear control flag. Setting this flag to 1 causes a Range-Abort message to be sent to the cable modem.

basCmtsPktDecodeControlTable.name: basCmtsPktDecodeControlTable
basCmtsPktDecodeControlTable.description: A list of BAS cmts packet decode control objects.

basCmtsPktDecodeControlEntry.name: basCmtsPktDecodeControlEntry
basCmtsPktDecodeControlEntry.description: An entry containing BAS Packet decode control settings. An entry in this table exists for each ifEntry with an ifType of docsCableMacLayer(127).

basCmtsMapDecodeControlTable.name: basCmtsMapDecodeControlTable
basCmtsMapDecodeControlTable.description: A list of BAS cmts map decode control objects.

basCmtsMapDecodeControlEntry.name: basCmtsMapDecodeControlEntry
basCmtsMapDecodeControlEntry.description: An entry containing BAS MAP decode control settings. An entry in this table exists for each ifEntry with an ifType of docsCableMacLayer(127).

basCmtsMacToSidTable.name: basCmtsMacToSidTable
basCmtsMacToSidTable.description: A list of BAS cmts mac to sid objects.

basCmtsMacToSidEntry.name: basCmtsMacToSidEntry
basCmtsMacToSidEntry.description: An entry containing BAS CMTS MAC to SID settings.

basCmtsMacToSidMacAddr.name: basCmtsMacToSidMacAddr
basCmtsMacToSidMacAddr.description: The MAC address of the host or the cable modem

basCmtsMacToSidServiceId.name: basCmtsMacToSidServiceId
basCmtsMacToSidServiceId.description: The SID of the host or the cable modem derived from the MAC

basCmtsMacToSidType.name: basCmtsMacToSidType
basCmtsMacToSidType.description: Type of device attached to this SID
